subtitleNullable: One-second resolution power consumption time series of various appliances.
descriptionNullable:
### Context 

Eco CO2 has acquired electric power consumption data of various appliances using 42 smart plugs deployed in 13 different households as measurement devices during one month. Time series data for each appliance was collected and represents a real-life use scenario for multiple anonymous users.
 

### Content 

The data set contains the following files: 

- `0_smart_plugs_devices.csv` contains information related to available smart plug device data. 
- Other files named `{plug_name}_{id}.csv` contains one-second interval power measurements in Watt with a corresponding timestamp for each appliance.

In `0_smart_plugs_devices.csv` file, available categories in the *appliance\_category* column according to the *plug\_name* column are: 

- _multimedia_ = [computer, 3D_printer, internet_router, laptop, phone_charger, printer, screen, tv, sound_system] 
- _kitchen_ = [boiler, coffee, freezer, fridge, micro_wave_oven] 
- _washing_ = [dishwasher, dryer, washing_machine] 
- _cooling_ = [air_conditioner, fan] 
- _other_ = [air_purifier, dehumidifier, radiator, solar_panel, vacuum] 

 

### Acknowledgements 

The data set has been recorded thanks to Eco CO2 employees who participated in the experimentation. 

### Inspiration

This data set can be used to explore the following questions: 
- extract data characteristic features and classify appliance load curves,
- characterize the varying power consumption signatures for various appliance categories, 
- calculate the percentage of the total consumption of an appliance when not being actively used (standby mode),
- aggregate individual appliance load curves to simulate the total power consumption of a household. Important assumptions include selection of which appliances to include in the total household consumption profile and the manipulation of timeseries data to simulate variable presents of users.
- identify peak consumption periods of a household based on the available appliances and simulate impact on peak load if load shifting was applied, 
- etc.
title: Household appliances power consumption
subtitle: One-second resolution power consumption time series of various appliances.
description:
### Context 

Eco CO2 has acquired electric power consumption data of various appliances using 42 smart plugs deployed in 13 different households as measurement devices during one month. Time series data for each appliance was collected and represents a real-life use scenario for multiple anonymous users.
 

### Content 

The data set contains the following files: 

- `0_smart_plugs_devices.csv` contains information related to available smart plug device data. 
- Other files named `{plug_name}_{id}.csv` contains one-second interval power measurements in Watt with a corresponding timestamp for each appliance.

In `0_smart_plugs_devices.csv` file, available categories in the *appliance\_category* column according to the *plug\_name* column are: 

- _multimedia_ = [computer, 3D_printer, internet_router, laptop, phone_charger, printer, screen, tv, sound_system] 
- _kitchen_ = [boiler, coffee, freezer, fridge, micro_wave_oven] 
- _washing_ = [dishwasher, dryer, washing_machine] 
- _cooling_ = [air_conditioner, fan] 
- _other_ = [air_purifier, dehumidifier, radiator, solar_panel, vacuum] 

 

### Acknowledgements 

The data set has been recorded thanks to Eco CO2 employees who participated in the experimentation. 

### Inspiration

This data set can be used to explore the following questions: 
- extract data characteristic features and classify appliance load curves,
- characterize the varying power consumption signatures for various appliance categories, 
- calculate the percentage of the total consumption of an appliance when not being actively used (standby mode),
- aggregate individual appliance load curves to simulate the total power consumption of a household. Important assumptions include selection of which appliances to include in the total household consumption profile and the manipulation of timeseries data to simulate variable presents of users.
- identify peak consumption periods of a household based on the available appliances and simulate impact on peak load if load shifting was applied, 
- etc.
